page.title: 10RUISLIP RAILWAY DEPOT
page.content: Ruislip Depot is on the central line and was built before the war as part of the London Passenger Transport Board's 1935-40 programme of improvements, and during the war was requisitioned by the admiralty. There are two main buildings in the depot: a large one for the repair of rolling stock and in which examination inspections are carried out and a smaller shed called the cleaning shed. The cleaning shed contains three 'roads' long enough for an eight car train.The washing machine is contained in a small building a short distance from the end of the cleaning shed. Trains from the shed are driven at walking pace through the machine. In the machine water jets clean the cars while motor driven felt strips wipe off the dirt. Along the south side of the shed are offices etc.
